display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 468px; height: 1px; padding-top: 165px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Responsibilities can be:
Marshalling/Unmarshalling
: Serialize/deserialize data for method parameters and return values.
Method Invocation
: Define and execute remote method calls based on client requests.
Error Handling
: Manage errors related to remote execution, exceptions, and retries.
Protocol Handling
: Define and manage the RPC communication protocols (e.g., JSON-RPC, gRPC, Thrift).
Security and Authentication
: Ensure security measures such as encryption, access control, and validation at the RPC level.
Request/Response Mapping
: Map client requests to remote procedures and return responses to the client.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 738px; height: 1px; padding-top: 540px; margin-left: 271px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.li:
Connection Management
: Establish, maintain, and terminate the network connections (e.g., HTTP, TCP).

Data Transmission
: Handle the actual transfer of request and response data between the client and server.

Reliability and Ordering
: Ensure data is reliably delivered and in the correct order (e.g., using TCP).

Flow Control
: Regulate the amount of data sent to avoid overwhelming the receiver (e.g., using congestion control).

Network Error Handling
: Manage network-level errors like timeouts, disconnects, and retries.

Security at the Transport Level
: Manage encryption (e.g., TLS) and basic transport security concerns.

Performance Optimization
: Handle compression, buffering, and multiplexing of connections for better performance.

Protocol Agnostic
: Abstract transport layer should be independent of the higher-level RPC protocol.

switch.text: Responsibilities can be:Connection Management: Establish, maintain, and terminate the network connections (e.g., HTTP, TCP)...
